suara-festival.title: Suara Festival Bali
suara-festival.overview: We are proud to be invited to the Suara Festival in Bali, Indonesia. Suara is an international event welcoming guests across seven seaside stages that blend music, thought leadership, art, culinary, wellness, and traditional Balinese performances on the cliffs of Nyanyi beach.
profile: Suara Festival is Indonesia's premier boutique festival, curating immersive experiences that seamlessly blend electronic music, wellness programming, culinary artistry, and Balinese culture.

Founded with a vision to create meaningful connections through music and mindfulness, Suara has become Southeast Asia's most sought-after festival destination, attracting conscious travelers and music enthusiasts from around the globe.
The festival's commitment to sustainability and cultural preservation has established it as a model for responsible event production in the region.
eventNarrative: This third edition welcomed more than nine thousand fans from over sixty countries during three incredible days. "This past weekend was undoubtedly one of the highlights of my 27-year career in curating and producing events worldwide," shared Suara Co-Founder, CEO, and Creative Director Jason Swamy.

K-array loudspeakers played a vital role. Producer Alexander Solonin and Sound Engineer Semen Chumanikhin said, "We had heard the power of K-array's flexible Anakonda line array system and Thunder-KS2 subwoofer at Nuanu recording studio, which sounded truly amazing." That confidence translated into a flawless festival experience.
additionalNotes: We are thrilled to have contributed to such a successful edition, enhancing every moment with K-array products. We look forward to partnering again for the fourth Suara Festival.
keyProducts: K-array Anakonda flexible line arrays across seven stages
K-array Thunder-KS2 subwoofers delivering powerful low end
Distributed control for seamless transitions between performances

reka-rix.title: REKA Interiors Exhibition (RiX)
reka-rix.overview: RiX is presented by C.I.S under REKA Design Week as the annual gathering for Malaysia's interior design community, curated by the Malaysian Institute of Interior Designers.
profile: The exhibition showcases only the best of each exhibitor's collections, tapping into Malaysia's interior design industry with conferences, forums, talks, networking, and workshops.
role: Nextrend Systems was invited to design the total sound solution for the CURIOS Pavilion and to speak on the topic "Design Senses - Sound."
eventNarrative: We selected the K-array Anakonda flexible system to line the pavilion walkway, delivering a balanced, immersive experience while respecting the pavilion's refined design.
Iconic Brionvega Radiofonografo RR126 and Totem RR231 pieces, each with more than fifty years of heritage, introduced museum-grade design and audio to the installation.
Inside the SoundPod Room, compact yet powerful K-array Lyzard KZ14 speakers in each corner created an enveloping soundscape that encouraged visitors to linger.

A discreet K-array Vyper KV102 installation anchored the final station, maintaining a refined atmosphere for tasting and conversation, while the Pinnacle KR402 powered live talks and performances on stage.
keyProducts: K-array Lyzard KZ14 micro line arrays
K-array Truffle KTR25 and Rumble KU210
Brionvega Radiofonografo RR126 and Totem RR231
Midas MR18, Frog-is Fi-WP2V, Shure microphones

brionvega-iconic-collection.title: Brionvega Iconic Audio Collection
brionvega-iconic-collection.overview: Brionvega is an Italian manufacturer of iconic audio objects established in 1960, collaborating with celebrated architects and designers to produce timeless pieces.
profile: Founded in 1960, Brionvega revolutionised the audio industry by treating sound systems as architectural objects, collaborating with legendary designers to create pieces that transcend functionality.

The brand's philosophy centers on the belief that technology should serve beauty, resulting in audio products that have earned places in prestigious museums worldwide, including MoMA and the Metropolitan Museum of Art.
Each Brionvega piece represents a perfect marriage of Italian craftsmanship and innovative engineering, maintaining relevance across generations while preserving their original design integrity.
eventNarrative: The Radiofonografo by Achille and Pier Giacomo Castiglioni remains globally recognised for its uniqueness, exclusivity, and craftsmanship. Revitalised with modern technology, it continues to deliver a stimulating listening experience.
Radiocubo by Marco Zanuso and Richard Sapper captures the vibrant spirit of the 1960s, designed to be proudly displayed as a centrepiece that blends nostalgia with contemporary living.
Totem by Mario Bellini, first introduced in 1971, transforms from a minimal cube into a modular hi-fi system, proving that industrial design can be both sculptural and sonically exceptional.
